text: The C&C; 46 is a Canadian sailboat, that was designed by C&C; Design and first built in 1973. The design was built by C&C; Yachts in Canada, but it is now out of production. ==Design== The C&C; 46 is a small recreational keelboat, built predominantly of fiberglass, with wood trim. It has a masthead sloop rig, an internally-mounted spade-type rudder controlled by a wheel and a fixed fin keel with lead ballast. It displaces . The boat has a draft of with the standard keel fitted and mounts an inboard diesel engine. The design has a PHRF racing average handicap of 66 and a hull speed of . ==See also== *List of sailing boat types ==References== Category:Keelboats Category:1970s sailboat type designs Category:Sailing yachts
title: C&C 46
